item.title: About me
item.description: School days Ever since my school days, I have been a curious tech geek who loves fiddling around with his devices and finding out how things work. This curiousity led me to dwell into the world of Android custom ROMs and Linux and I was instantly in love with them. While exploring the different Linux distributions, I came across Kali Linux. At first I was intrigued by the whole lot of pre-installed applications it came with.

item.title: Home Lab
item.description: A lab environment consisting of a home server, a couple of switches, a wifi access point, router and firewall. Homeserver: Proxmox is installed on the homeserver and runs the following services as of today: NAS (Network Attached Storage) Jellyfin Opnsense PiHole Network: The backbone of the network is 2.5G ready Opnsense - Router, firewall Different WiFi networks for trusted and untrusted devices Future plans: Setup a test AD environment, SIEM and many more things.

item.title: Passwordless Authentication
item.description: A switch from the traditional, most common form of authentication used today based on something-we-know, commonly passwords to someone-who-we-are was developed. The solution makes use of biometrics, mostly fingerprint to authenticate a user. It makes use of Android smartphones with fingerprint sensor. An Android application using Kotlin and Android Studio was created to demonstrate the same.

item.title: Secure and Private Decentralised Instant Messenger
item.description: Capstone project done in the final year of engineering. Modified Singal protocol to work with decentralized systems. More details can be found in the paper published associated with the project. Paper
